overview.summary: The module takes two triangulated meshes representing two closed surfaces, one inside the other, and calculates transfer matrix to transfer potential values from inner to outer surface

description.p: The basic idea underlying the module implementation was taken from [1]. The methods in numerical estimation of integral parts of the problem setup were provided by Rob McLeod and Guo Tang

listitem.p: R.C.Barr, et.al., "Relating Epicardial to Body Surface Potential Distributions by Means of Transfer Coefficients Based on Geometry Measurements", IEEE Trans Biom Eng, v.24, no.1, Jan. 1977

note.p: The actual computation of the matrix is done by the BioPSE::Algorithm::BuildBEMatrix::build_BEMatrix()

description.p: Takes a handle to Field object representing inner surface
Takes a handle to Field object representing outer surface
Sends a handle to the transfer matrix

note.p: The handle is to base class of DenseMatrix (Matrix)

description.p: Sends handle to the field object containing outer surface and calculated potentials at the nodes. If no potentials were supplied on inner surface, the field contains zero potentials
